Package org.neo4j.internal.schema

Interface SchemaDescriptor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    SchemaDescriptorSupplier
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FulltextSchemaDescriptor, LabelSchemaDescriptor, RelationTypeSchemaDescriptor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NoSchemaDescriptor, SchemaDescriptorImplementation
    public interface SchemaDescriptor
extends SchemaDescriptorSupplier
    Internal representation of one schema unit, for example a label-property pair. Even when only supporting a small set of different schemas, the number of common methods is very small. This interface therefore supports a visitor type access pattern, results can be computed using the {#compute} method, and side-effect type logic performed using the processWith method. This means that when implementing this interface with a new concrete type, the compute and processWith method implementations need to be added similarly to how this is done in eg. LabelSchemaDescriptor, and the SchemaProcessor and SchemaComputer interfaces need to be extended with methods taking the new concrete type as argument.

      • equalTo

        static <T extends SchemaDescriptorSupplier> Predicate<T> equalTo​(SchemaDescriptor descriptor)
        Create a predicate that checks whether a schema descriptor Supplier supplies the given schema descriptor.
        Parameters:
        descriptor - The schema descriptor to check equality with.
        Returns:
        A predicate that returns true if it is given a schema descriptor supplier that supplies the same schema descriptor as the given schema descriptor.

      • isLabelSchemaDescriptor

        boolean isLabelSchemaDescriptor()
        Test if this schema descriptor is a LabelSchemaDescriptor.
        Returns:
        true if calling asLabelSchemaDescriptor() will not throw an exception.

      • asLabelSchemaDescriptor

        LabelSchemaDescriptor asLabelSchemaDescriptor()
        If this schema descriptor matches the structure required by LabelSchemaDescriptor, then return this descriptor as that type. Otherwise, throw an IllegalStateException.

      • isRelationshipTypeSchemaDescriptor

        boolean isRelationshipTypeSchemaDescriptor()
        Test if this schema descriptor is a RelationTypeSchemaDescriptor.
        Returns:
        true if calling asRelationshipTypeSchemaDescriptor() will not throw an exception.

      • asRelationshipTypeSchemaDescriptor

        RelationTypeSchemaDescriptor asRelationshipTypeSchemaDescriptor()
        If this schema descriptor matches the structure required by RelationTypeSchemaDescriptor, then return this descriptor as that type. Otherwise, throw an IllegalStateException.

      • isFulltextSchemaDescriptor

        boolean isFulltextSchemaDescriptor()
        Test if this schema descriptor is a FulltextSchemaDescriptor.
        Returns:
        true if calling asFulltextSchemaDescriptor() will not throw an exception.

      • asFulltextSchemaDescriptor

        FulltextSchemaDescriptor asFulltextSchemaDescriptor()
        If this schema descriptor matches the structure required by FulltextSchemaDescriptor, then return this descriptor as that type. Otherwise, throw an IllegalStateException.

      • isAffected

        boolean isAffected​(long[] entityTokenIds)
        Returns true if any of the given entity token ids are part of this schema unit.
        Parameters:
        entityTokenIds - entity token ids to check against.
        Returns:
        true if the supplied ids are relevant to this schema unit.

      • processWith

        void processWith​(SchemaProcessor processor)
        Performs some side-effect type logic by processing this object using the given SchemaProcessor. Note that implementers of this method just need to call `return processor.process( this );`.
        Parameters:
        processor - The SchemaProcessor that hold the logic for the computation

      • getPropertyIds

        int[] getPropertyIds()
        This method return the property ids that are relevant to this Schema Descriptor. Putting this method here is a convenience that will break if/when we introduce more complicated schema descriptors like paths, but until that point it is very useful.
        Returns:
        the property ids

      • getPropertyId

        default int getPropertyId()
        Assume that this schema descriptor describes a schema that includes a single property id, and return that id.
        Returns:
        The presumed single property id of this schema.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this schema does not have exactly one property.

      • getEntityTokenIds

        int[] getEntityTokenIds()
        This method returns the entity token ids handled by this descriptor.
        Returns:
        the entity token ids that this schema descriptor represents

      • getLabelId

        default int getLabelId()
        Assuming this schema descriptor represents a schema on nodes, with a single label id, then get that label id. Otherwise an exception is thrown.

      • getRelTypeId

        default int getRelTypeId()
        Assuming this schema descriptor represents a schema on relationships, with a single relationship type id, then get that relationship type id. Otherwise an exception is thrown.

      • lockingKeys

        default long[] lockingKeys()
        Get the ids that together with the keyType() can be used to acquire the schema locks needed to lock the schema represented by this descriptor.

      • keyType

        ResourceType keyType()
        Type of underlying schema descriptor key. Key is part of schema unit that determines which resources with specified properties are applicable.
        Returns:
        type of underlying key

      • entityType

        EntityType entityType()
        Type of entities this schema represents.
        Returns:
        entity type

      • propertySchemaType

        PropertySchemaType propertySchemaType()
        Returns the type of this schema. See PropertySchemaType.
        Returns:
        PropertySchemaType of this schema unit.
